programme.title: Gold Standard Ep5
programme.desc: "Heart and Grit in the Desert" – Qatar 2015 The 2015 Championship in Qatar saw France conquer immense pressure to beat the host nation in a gripping final. Led by legends like Omeyer and Karabatić, they earned their fifth title and cemented their legacy.

programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. Expect tight time allowed, flowing lines, and smart tactics on stride counts and anchor placement as title contenders push for pole.

programme.title: Team – Round 1 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The GCL Team Round 1 opens the Rome leg at the Foro Italico. Two riders per squad chase fast, fault-free trips to set the overnight order and carry scores into Round 2. programme.title: Team - Round 2 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The decisive GCL Team Round 2. Reverse-order start from Round 1, with every rail and second counting toward the combined team total. Strategic rider swaps and cool heads over a technical track shape the podium and precious championship points in a high-stakes Roman finish.

programme.title: Team - Round 2 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA

programme.title: CSI5 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: Top combinations tackle elite CSI5* classes at the Foro Italico. A technical track, tight time allowed and related lines test precision and power, with the fastest clears advancing to a jump-off. Expect fine margins, inside turns and bold strides as riders chase ranking points and momentum for the Grand Prix.

programme.title: CSI5 - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA

programme.title: Grand Prix of Rome - Longines Global Champions Tour - Rome, ITA
programme.desc: The 1.60m LGCT Grand Prix: one round plus jump-off for big championship points and a golden ticket to the Prague Playoffs Super Grand Prix. Huge oxers, delicate verticals and a demanding time allowed reward brave riding and perfect stride control in a high-stakes Roman finale.

programme.title: Latvia vs England - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: This will be the second meeting between Latvia and England, with the first coming in March this year when the Three Lions won 3-0 at Wembley with goals from Reece James, Harry Kane and Eberechi Eze. Latvia will be the 72nd nation England have played an away match against – they’ve won their last three first time away games against a nation.

programme.title: North. Ireland vs Germany - UEFA European Qualifiers World Cup 2026 - MD8
programme.desc: Northern Ireland are winless in their last 13 matches against Germany, losing the last 10 in a row. They last beat them back in November 1983 in a European Championship qualifier. Germany have won seven of their nine away matches against Northern Ireland, winning the last five in a row and scoring 15 goals in the process. Their most recent visit was a 2-0 win in September 2019 in a European Championship qualifier.

programme.title: One Friday Fight -129
programme.desc: ONE Friday Fights 129 lights up Bangkok on Oct 17 with 12 bouts across Muay Thai, MMA, and kickboxing. Expect fireworks in the headliner as Thailand’s Tengnueng collides with Myanmar’s Tun Min Aung in a KO-hungry showdown. Plus, standout clashes: Petlampun vs Ayad Albadr, and 19-year-old Fergus Smith vs Zahran Al-Wesabi. Live from Lumpinee Boxing Stadium, its elbows, knees, and spinning kicks all night in a stacked showcase. Prelims spotlight rising prospects; main card promises fast finishes.

programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Taffakur
programme.desc: Islam teaches Muslims about ‘Tawakkul’ meaning trusting in God’s plan. Muslims believe in the idea that with anything in life we put forward our best efforts but ultimately the rest is left to God and believing whatever the outcome, it was pre-written. Omar Marmoush is the feature athlete in the final episode of the series – from the outskirts of the Eintracht Frankfurt side to an $80m move to Premier League Manchester City, his last 18 months has seen an incredible rise. His love of Ramadan and belief that fasting elevates his game is a central theme of the final episode alongside detail of his early life, career and his unfaltering belief in Islam. programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Taffakur
programme.desc: Islam teaches Muslims about ‘Tawakkul’ meaning trusting in God’s plan. Muslims believe in the idea that with anything in life we put forward our best efforts but ultimately the rest is left to God and believing whatever the outcome, it was pre-written. Omar Marmoush is the feature athlete in the final episode of the series – from the outskirts of the Eintracht Frankfurt side to an $80m move to Premier League Manchester City, his last 18 months has seen an incredible rise. His love of Ramadan and belief that fasting elevates his game is a central theme of the final episode alongside detail of his early life, career and his unfaltering belief in Islam. programme.title: My Faith in Sport - Sawm
programme.desc: Ramadan is a crucial period in the Islamic calendar but fasting (Sawm) can provide complications for athletes who are trying to compete at the highest level. But to what extent is fasting a negative or can it actually aid performance? We look at the life and adaptation throughout Ramadan of Adam Azim – an unbeaten professional boxer from the UK, Fares El Bakh – a weightlifter who won Qatar’s first ever Olympic gold medal, and Zainab Alema – a rugby player who is aiming to become the first player to represent England wearing a hijab. Experts in Sports Science and Nutrition from Aspetar Clinic, Qatar also add detail of the physical impact athletes encounter during Ramadan.

programme.title: PALESTINE, ONE JERSEY, MANY ROOTS
programme.desc: Story of the Palestinian national football team, a team that is far more than the sum of its players. Separated by borders, by checkpoints, and exile, the tells is inspiring “One Jersey…Many Roots” them is a single jersey, a shared dream, and a deep sense of responsibility to players come from every corner of Palestine and from communities scattered across the globe. What unites represent their people on and off the pitch that Palestine endures. This is not just in every match, they carry not just a ball but the weight of history, identity and hope. programme.title: Qatar vs UAE - AFC Asian Qualifiers Road To 26 Playoffs - MD3 - Mini Match
programme.desc: The fourth round of AFC 2026 FIFA World Cup Qualification matches take place over three days. The third-placed and fourth-placed teams from the third round were divided into two groups of three teams. Group A features Qatar, UAE & Oman and will play their matches in Qatar. Group B Features KSA, Iraq & Indonesia who will play their games in KSA. The winners of each group will qualify directly for the 2026 FIFA World Cup, while the runners-up will advance to the fifth round.

programme.title: PALESTINE, ONE JERSEY, MANY ROOTS
programme.desc: Story of the Palestinian national football team, a team that is far more than the sum of its players. Separated by borders, by checkpoints, and exile, the tells is inspiring “One Jersey…Many Roots” them is a single jersey, a shared dream, and a deep sense of responsibility to players come from every corner of Palestine and from communities scattered across the globe. What unites represent their people on and off the pitch that Palestine endures. This is not just in every match, they carry not just a ball but the weight of history, identity and hope. Fot their supporters, each goal is a voice, each victory a declaration. Football it s a living emblem of unity, resilience and the unbreakable b

The third-placed and fourth-placed teams from the third round were divided into two groups of three teams. Group A features Qatar, UAE & Oman and will play their matches in Qatar. The winners of each group will qualify directly for the 2026 FIFA World Cup, while the runners-up will advance to the fifth round.

programme.title: Real Madrid vs Villarreal -Spanish LaLiga 2025/26 - Week 8 - Mini Match

programme.title: Lille vs PSG - French Ligue 1 2025/2026 Week 7
programme.desc: Lille have won just one of their last 13 home Ligue 1 games against Paris SG, a 5-1 victory on 14 April 2019, which remains Paris Saint-Germain's biggest away defeat in the top-flight in the 21st century. Lille have lost their last two Ligue 1 matches and could suffer three consecutive defeats in the competition for the first time since December 2019-January 2020. Lille could also fail to score in three consecutive Ligue 1 games for the first time since September 2017.

programme.title: Al Ahli Saudi FC (KSA) vs PFC Nasaf (UZB) - AFC Champions League Elite 2025/2026 - West MD1
programme.desc: This will be the fifth AFC Champions League Elite meeting between Al-Ahli and Nasaf, with Nasaf’s only win coming in their most recent such game on 2 March 2016 ; Al-Ahli’s most recent game in the competition against Uzbek opposition was a 2-1 win over Pakhtakor Tashkent on 20 May 2019, a win here will see them win two consecutive such games for the first time in competition history. programme.title: Chelsea vs Benfica - UEFA Champions League 2025/26 - MD2
programme.desc: Chelsea have won all four of their competitive meetings with Benfica, with the most recent of those coming earlier this year at the FIFA Club World Cup. This will be the first meeting between Chelsea and Benfica in the group/league phase of a competition, with the previous four all having come in the knockout stages: UEFA Champions League quarter-finals in 2011-12, UEFA Europa League final in 2012-13 and the FIFA Club World Cup last 16 earlier this year.

programme.title: Yannick HANFMANN (GER) vs Matteo ARNALDI (ITA) - ATP 250 - European open 2025 - Brussels
programme.desc: ATP 250 European Open 2025 (10th edition) debuts in Brussels after nine years in Antwerp, staged on indoor-hard courts at Brussels Expo (Palais 12), 13–19 Oct. Draw sizes: 28-player singles / 16-team doubles. Prize money: €706,850. Expect fast, first-strike tennis, sharp returns and tie-break pressure as contenders fight for late-season ranking points and momentum toward Turin.

programme.title: Race 1 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano weekend opens with a sprint that rewards clean starts, tyre warm-up and bravery through Curvone. Expect late dives into Turn 1, heavy braking at Quercia and traction duels out of Tramonto onto the back straight. Safety cars and track-limits calls can flip the order, while newcomers hunt points and title hopefuls set the tone for the round.

programme.title: Race 1 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano weekend opens with a sprint that rewards clean starts, tyre warm-up and bravery through Curvone. Expect late dives into Turn 1, heavy braking at Quercia and traction duels out of Tramonto onto the back straight. Safety cars and track-limits calls can flip the order, while newcomers hunt points and title hopefuls set the tone for the round.

programme.title: Race 2 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 2 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 3 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: With setups refined, Race 3 is often the weekend’s fiercest sprint. Nose-to-tail packs form into Turn 1, while rhythm and patience through the fast right-lefts keep front tyres alive. Curvone commitment and a tidy run to Quercia create overtaking chances. Expect bold moves, defensive elbows, and strategy on push laps to climb

programme.title: Race 3 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025

programme.title: Race 4 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: The Misano finale. Championship hopefuls chase maximum points as fatigue, tyre life and track limits shape the last attacks. A strong launch, disciplined braking at Quercia and perfect traction from Tramonto decide podiums. Anticipate safety-car drama, photo-finish drafts to the stripe, and decisive moves under pressure as the round closes with a flat-out sprint.

programme.title: Race 4 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025

programme.title: Race 5 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: Rising talents go wheel-to-wheel at Misano World Circuit Marco Simoncelli in Race 5. Slipstreams on the main straight and commitment through Curvone shape the order, while track limits, safety cars, and bold restarts can flip everything late. A flat-out sprint where newcomers and title hopefuls fight to the flag.

programme.title: Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
Race - Qiddiya Round - Extreme H World Cup 2025
programme.desc: Extreme H World Cup hits Qiddiya for a desert race. Hydrogen-powered Pioneer 25 SUVs face Time Trials, head-to-head heats, and a multi-car Grand Final, with energy management, tyre wear and route choice deciding positions. Expect dunes, dust and daring passes under the Tuwaiq cliffs, driver switches, and strategy on boost usage as teams chase points, manufacturer bragging rights and momentum in the sport’s new zero-emissions era. Broadcast highlights and on-board shots bring the action home.

programme.desc: Race 2 reshuffles the deck after overnight tweaks. Warmer track temps raise tyre-degradation stakes, making slipstream timing on the main straight vital. Inside lines at Turn 1 and measured exits from Tramonto decide most passes. Watch for undercuts on out-laps, safety-car restarts, and penalties for track limits as contenders bank crucial mid-round points.

programme.title: Race 3 - Formula 4 Italy - Misano Round - 2025
programme.desc: With setups refined, Race 3 is often the weekend’s fiercest sprint. Nose-to-tail packs form into Turn 1, while rhythm and patience through the fast right-lefts keep front tyres alive. Curvone commitment and a tidy run to Quercia create overtaking chances. Expect bold moves, defensive elbows, and strategy on push laps to climb

programme.title: Delfina Brea Senesi (ARG) / Gemma Triay Pons (ESP) vs Ariana Sanchez Fallada (ESP) / Paula Josemari
programme.desc: World No.1 pairing Gemma Triay/Delfina Brea face No.2 Ariana Sánchez/Paula Josemaría at Rotterdam Ahoy. A classic rivalry: Triay/Brea lead the season with multiple titles, including Germany P2 last week, while Sánchez/Josemaría chase revenge after losing six of seven meetings this year. Expect sharp returns, low volleys, and golden-point pressure in a battle for supremacy.

programme.title: Arturo Coello (ESP) / Agustin Tapia (ARG) vs Federico Chingotto (ARG) / Alejandro Galan (ESP) - Men
programme.desc: Top seeds Arturo Coello/Agustín Tapia clash with No.2 Alejandro Galán/Federico Chingotto. Coello/Tapia dominated most of 2025, but Galán/Chingotto struck back with victory in Germany P2. Head-to-head favors Coello/Tapia, yet momentum is split after recent meetings. Indoor conditions at Rotterdam Ahoy amplify aggressive volleys and x-3 smashes, setting up a high-stakes P1 decider.

programme.desc: Dive into the excitement of French handball with Liqui Moly Starligue, formerly LNH Division 1. programme.desc: Stockholm (13–19 Oct). Indoor hard at Kungliga Tennishallen. Draws: 28 singles / 16 doubles. Prize money: €706,850.
